translated: The Elder Nun Mekhalā’s Verses🔽“I was one who made a shrine
And when the great shrine was finished,🔽I gave a girdle again,
with my own hands, with faith,
for the Sage, the Protector of the World.

analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe  yam mekhalam adam tadā
translated: For ninety-four aeons🔽I do not recall that girdle,
and I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of making a shrine.
My defilements have been burnt up,
I have done what the Buddha said.
I have done what the Buddha said.”🔽Thus the nun Mekhalā recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ mekhalādāyikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Mekhalādāyikātheriyāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam mekhalādāyikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽mekhalādāyikātheriyā apadānam
translated: The Chapter with Mekhalā’s Verses is finished.
